class.name: TextColumnCollection
class.description: A collection of [Word.TextColumn](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.textcolumn) objects that represent all the columns of text in the document or a section of the document.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a TextColumnCollection to verify the connection to the Word host application and log its properties.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.

examples.description: Display the width of each text column in the first section of the document to the console.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Returns a TextColumn object that represents a new text column added to a section or document.

params.name: options
params.description: Options for configuring the new text column.

returns.description: A TextColumn object that represents a new text column added to the document.

examples.description: Add a new text column to the first section of the document to create a two-column layout

methods.name: getFlowDirection
methods.description: Gets the direction in which text flows from one text column to the next.

examples.description: Check the text flow direction of columns in the first section and display it in the console

methods.name: getHasLineBetween
methods.description: Gets whether vertical lines appear between all the columns in the TextColumnCollection object.

examples.description: Check if vertical lines are displayed between text columns in the active document and display the result in the console.

methods.name: getIsEvenlySpaced
methods.description: Gets whether text columns are evenly spaced.

examples.description: Check if the text columns in the first section are evenly spaced and display the result in the console.

methods.name: getItem
methods.description: Gets a TextColumn by its index in the collection.

params.name: index
params.description: A number that identifies the index location of a TextColumn object.

examples.description: Get the second text column from the first section and highlight its text in yellow

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the number of text columns and their spacing in the first section of the document

methods.name: setCount
methods.description: Arranges text into the specified number of text columns.

params.name: numColumns
params.description: The number of columns the text is to be arranged into.

examples.description: Set the current section to display text in 3 columns

methods.name: setFlowDirection
methods.description: Sets the direction in which text flows from one text column to the next.

examples.description: Set the text flow direction to right-to-left for the first section's columns (useful for languages like Arabic or Hebrew)

methods.name: setHasLineBetween
methods.description: Sets whether vertical lines appear between all the columns in the TextColumnCollection object.

params.name: value
params.description: true to show vertical lines between columns.

examples.description: Configure a document section to display three text columns with vertical lines between them

methods.name: setIsEvenlySpaced
methods.description: Sets whether text columns are evenly spaced.

params.name: value
params.description: true to evenly space all the text columns in the document.

examples.description: Set the text columns in the active document to be unevenly spaced (custom spacing between columns)

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.TextColumnCollection object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.TextColumnCollectionData) that contains an "items" array with shallow copies of any loaded properties from the collection's items.

examples.description: Export text column configuration to JSON for logging or storage purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track text columns in a section to monitor and adjust column properties across multiple sync calls without encountering InvalidObjectPath errors

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load text column information from a section, use it to log column count, then untrack the collection to free memory.
